description:
“She’s 98.  And the isolation and loneliness came over her in a river of tears at my visit.  Not able to see her son or daughter for 6 weeks.  She wants to die.  Because at 98 the waiting is too much.  I offered to FaceTime her son.
She cried more. She wanted a real hug.  I in my PPE said enough.  I too bent over into her arms she wrapped so tight around me.  I broke the rule. I hugged her till she could breathe.  We both had a healing.  I’d do it again.  Love matters most.  The older folks in long term care haven’t been touched or hugged.  It’s causing failure to thrive.  Hugs are a necessary part of living. “ - shared from a nurse from a Covid healthcare workers site, because
THIS right here is what the world needs to see ❤️
(shared with approval of said nurse...thank you) Jennifer Rose.
-
